title: Deploy your first app!
content: # 🚀 Deploy Your AO + React App to Arweave with ArLink

title: Deploy your first app!
content: You’ve built your app — now it’s time to **go live** on the **permaweb** using [Arweave](https://www.arweave.org) and **ArLink**.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: **Arweave** isn't just for storing images or files; it can also host your **entire application permanently**. However, specific configurations are necessary to ensure your app works correctly on the permaweb.

title: Deploy your first app!
content: Arweave operates as a decentralized storage network without traditional server-side routing. This means client-side routing configurations (e.g. `HashRouter`) are crucial. Without them, users may encounter broken links or refresh errors.

title: Deploy your first app!

title: Deploy your first app!

title: Funding your wallet
content: description: "Learn how to acquire AR tokens and convert them into AO-compatible tokens to fully utilize your Wander Wallet in the Arweave and AO ecosystems."

title: Funding your wallet

title: Funding your wallet
content: To interact with the Arweave and AO ecosystems using your **Wander Wallet**, you'll need to acquire **AR** tokens. If you are only looking to deploy applications, AR tokens are enough (for now). However, if you wish to utilize more features, you may need to convert them into **AO-compatible tokens**.

title: Funding your wallet
content: ## Understanding AR and Its Role in the AO Ecosystem

title: Funding your wallet
content: **AR** is the native token of the Arweave network, used primarily for permanent data storage.

title: Funding your wallet
content: However, to utilize AR within the AO ecosystem, it must be converted into AO-compatible tokens such as **wAR** (wrapped AR) or **qAR** (Quantum-wrapped AR).

title: Funding your wallet
content: This conversion allows you to interact seamlessly with decentralized applications (dApps) and services within AO.

title: Funding your wallet
content: ## Steps to Acquire and Utilize AR in the AO Ecosystem

title: Funding your wallet
content: 1. Sign up and complete verification on the exchange.

title: Funding your wallet
content: 2. Deposit funds (e.g., bank transfer, credit card, or crypto deposit).

title: Funding your wallet
content: 4. Withdraw the `AR` tokens to your Wander Wallet address.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Use integrated fiat onramps like **Transak** to purchase AR directly using your debit/credit card.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - KYC may be required depending on region.

title: Funding your wallet
content: Once your Wander Wallet holds `AR`, convert it to `wAR` or `qAR` to participate in the AO ecosystem.

title: Funding your wallet
content: #### 🧱 Bridge AR to wAR via AOX

title: Funding your wallet
content: - **Use Case:** Convert AR to wAR for use in AO-native dApps and swaps.

title: Funding your wallet
content: 2. Select Arweave → AO bridge and choose `AR → wAR`.

title: Funding your wallet
content: 3. Enter amount and confirm the transaction.

title: Funding your wallet
content: #### 🛰 Wrap AR into qAR via Astro USD Bridge

title: Funding your wallet
content: - **Note:** This is *not* a cross-chain bridge. It wraps AR into `qAR` (Quantum-wrapped AR), used for Quantum-based dApps.

title: Funding your wallet
content: 2. Enter the amount of AR to wrap.

title: Funding your wallet
content: Once you have `wAR` or `qAR`, you can trade inside the AO ecosystem.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - **Features:** Market swaps, limit orders, fast execution.

title: Funding your wallet
content: - Testnet AO DEX by Krab Tech.

title: Funding your wallet
content: Once you’ve acquired wAR or qAR, explore available AO dApps inside the Wander Wallet:

content: - Browse and launch supported applications like swaps, bridges, and more

content: **Handlers** in AO are event-driven functions that listen to incoming messages in the process inbox. When a message arrives with an `Action` tag that matches a handler name, the respective function is executed.

title: Creating CRUD Application
content: Think of handlers like **API endpoints** in traditional Web2 backend systems. Just like a `POST /create` route in Express.js would trigger a controller to insert a record into a database, an AO handler listens for `Create-Post` actions and runs logic to insert into the SQLite table.

title: Lua Handlers
content: # Understanding Handlers in AO Lua Processes

title: Lua Handlers
content: In the Actor-Oriented (AO) computing paradigm on the Arweave network, `handlers` are essential constructs that define how processes respond to incoming messages. They enable AO processes to manage and execute logic based on pattern matching, facilitating responsive and autonomous decentralized programs.

title: Lua Handlers
content: A **handler** in AO is a function that gets executed when a message matching a specific pattern arrives in a process's inbox.

title: Signing Transactions
content: title: "The Importance of Signing Transactions in Arweave"

title: Signing Transactions
content: description: "Understand the critical role of transaction signing in the Arweave ecosystem, ensuring security, authenticity, and trust in decentralized applications."

title: Signing Transactions
content: In the Arweave and AO ecosystems, **signing a transaction** is how you prove you're authorized to send it. Whether you're uploading a file, creating a new process, or interacting with a smart contract, your transaction must be signed with your wallet.

title: Signing Transactions
content: Think of signing like **digitally sealing an envelope**. The network needs to verify that:

title: Signing Transactions
content: - You're the owner of the wallet.

title: Signing Transactions
content: - The data hasn't been tampered with.

title: Signing Transactions
content: Without signing, no node would trust the request. Signed transactions are cryptographically verified by the network before being accepted into the permanent ledger, ensuring that only legitimate requests are processed.

title: Signing Transactions
content: Your **wallet** contains a public/private key pair:

title: Signing Transactions
content: - The **public key** is your wallet address (like an account number).

title: Signing Transactions
content: - The **private key** is your signature tool — it proves the message is really from you.

title: Signing Transactions
content: A wallet in the Arweave network is essentially a **JSON file** containing the user's **private key**, which is crucial for signing transactions.

title: Signing Transactions
content: When you sign a transaction, you're using your private key to prove intent. This is what allows decentralized apps to verify identity **without passwords or centralized servers**, fostering a trustless environment.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: **UCM BazAR** is a decentralized marketplace built on the Arweave network, enabling users to create, trade, and manage atomic assets securely and efficiently. By utilizing the Universal Content Marketplace (UCM) protocol and Arweave's permanent storage capabilities, BazAR ensures that all digital assets are stored fully on-chain, providing immutability and censorship resistance.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: Atomic assets are digital items where all associated data is stored under a single Arweave transaction ID, ensuring complete on-chain storage. This approach guarantees that assets are immutable and permanently accessible without reliance on centralized servers. Additionally, atomic assets can be fractionalized, allowing multiple users to own portions of a single asset, with ownership represented by Profit Sharing Tokens (PSTs).

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - **Trustless Transactions**: Facilitates peer-to-peer trading without intermediaries, leveraging the UCM protocol for secure exchanges.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - **Fractional Ownership**: Supports the division of assets into shares, enabling collective ownership and investment.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - **Enhanced Performance**: By operating on AO, a hyper-parallel computing system on Arweave, BazAR benefits from improved transaction speeds and scalability.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - **Profile Agents**: Users have dedicated AO processes managing their profiles, streamlining interactions within the marketplace.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - **Creator Control**: Allows asset creators to define usage rights and monetization terms, embedding them directly into the asset's metadata.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: - **Transparent Licensing**: Ensures that all licensing terms are publicly accessible and enforceable on-chain.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: ✅ **Permanent Storage**: Assets are stored indefinitely on Arweave, ensuring longevity and accessibility.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: ✅ **Censorship Resistance**: The decentralized nature of Arweave and AO prevents unauthorized alterations or removals.

title: What is UCM BazAR?
content: ✅ **Ecosystem Rewards**: Users engaging with the platform can earn tokens like $PIXL, incentivizing active participation.

title: Funding Wallet
content: UCM BazAR operates on Arweave and AO — two powerful decentralized networks that require wallet funding with AR tokens to enable storage and transactions.

title: Funding Wallet
content: ## 🔹 Step-by-Step: How to Fund Your Wallet

title: Funding Wallet
content: You can obtain AR tokens from centralized exchanges like Binance, KuCoin, or Gate.io. These tokens are the native currency of the Arweave network and are required to store content or execute transactions.

title: Funding Wallet
content: After purchase, transfer the AR tokens to your personal wallet. You can use a compatible wallet such as **ArConnect** or **Wander Wallet**. Once in your wallet, you're ready to use UCM BazAR.

title: Funding Wallet
content: To use your AR in the AO ecosystem (where on-chain computation happens), it must be converted into AO-compatible tokens like **wAR** (wrapped AR) or **qAR** (quantum AR).

title: Funding Wallet
content: You can learn more about how this conversion works — including how to use bridges like AOX or Astro — in the **[Funding Guide](./developers/get-started/wallets/fund-wallet)**.

title: Funding Wallet
content: - 🧠 **Compute & Interact**: AR funds storage on Arweave, but wAR/qAR unlock your ability to run bots, agents, or services in AO.

title: Funding Wallet
content: - 🔄 **Dynamic Usage**: Computation costs and usage fees are deducted in real time as you interact with dApps in UCM BazAR.

title: Funding Wallet
content: > 💡 Think of AR as the raw fuel — but to power advanced features like AO computations, you need the right form of that fuel.

content: - **Transfer**: Move your purchased AR tokens to your wallet address.

content: - **Conversion Needed**: To utilize services within the AO ecosystem, convert AR to AO-compatible tokens like **wAR** (wrapped AR) or **qAR**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: title: "Introduction to Arweave: The Future of Permanent Data Storage"

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: description: "Discover how Arweave revolutionizes data storage with its decentralized protocol, offering a unique 'pay once, store forever' model that ensures data immutability and accessibility."

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Arweave is a groundbreaking **decentralized storage protocol** designed to provide **permanent data storage solutions**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Unlike traditional storage systems that require recurring payments and are susceptible to data loss or censorship, Arweave offers a unique **"pay once, store forever"** model. This approach ensures that **data remains immutable and perpetually accessible**, revolutionizing how information is preserved in the digital age.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: At the core of Arweave's architecture is the **blockweave**, an innovative data structure that differentiates it from conventional blockchains:

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - Traditional blockchains form a linear sequence.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - Arweave's **blockweave links each block to both the previous block and a randomly selected earlier block**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - This enhances **data redundancy** and plays a key role in the network’s **Proof of Access (PoA)** consensus mechanism.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: When users upload data, they **pay a one-time fee in AR tokens**:

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - A portion is allocated to a **storage endowment**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - The endowment generates **returns to compensate miners**, ensuring **data remains available indefinitely**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Arweave fosters a **community-driven ecosystem** where developers can build:

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - **Gateways** that provide seamless access to stored data.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: - [Arweave for Newbies: How It Works and Why It Exists](https://x.com/onlyarweave/status/1805983704549929286)

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Arweave is a decentralized protocol designed for **permanent data storage**, allowing users to preserve information indefinitely with a single, one-time fee.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Secured by a network of **miners rewarded with AR tokens**, Arweave ensures data is replicated and remains accessible through a **sustainable endowment model**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: This approach supports the **permaweb**—a collection of permanent web pages and applications **free from centralized control**, fostering a space where **history and culture are preserved**, and **free speech is upheld**.

title: Introduction to Arweave
content: Developers are empowered to create **fully decentralized applications** on the permaweb, contributing to a more **resilient and open internet**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: title: "Scalability Innovations in Arweave: Overcoming Blockchain Challenges"

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: description: "Explore how Arweave addresses scalability issues in blockchain-based storage through unique innovations like uniform data storage, transaction bundling, and recursive bundling."

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: One of the biggest challenges in **blockchain-based storage solutions** is **scalability**. Arweave tackles this challenge through **unique innovations** that allow it to scale indefinitely.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: Unlike **contract-based storage systems** that require complex verification, Arweave applies a **single set of rules**:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **"Pay once, store forever"** → Eliminates the need for constant payment models.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **All transactions follow the same storage principles**, reducing processing complexity.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: Instead of processing transactions individually, Arweave allows:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Multiple transactions to be combined into a single bundle**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: This process is governed by the **Arweave Network Standard -104**, ensuring efficiency.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: When too many transactions are submitted, **recursive bundling** is used:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Bundles are combined into larger bundles before submission**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - This allows an **unlimited number of transactions** in a single Arweave operation.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: Arweave’s **storage model assumes costs will decrease over time**, making it:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **More efficient than traditional cloud storage solutions**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - [How Arweave Scales: Storing All the Data on the Web](https://arweave.org/)

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - [Arweave for Newbies: How It Works and Why It Exists](https://x.com/onlyarweave/status/1805983704549929286)

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: description: "Discover how Arweave achieves scalability through innovative techniques like transaction bundling, blockweave structure, and recursive bundling, ensuring efficient and permanent data storage."

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: Arweave achieves **scalability** through several key innovations:

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Transaction bundling** → Multiple transactions are combined into a single block, improving efficiency.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Blockweave structure** → Uses a **Proof of Access (PoA) consensus** to ensure redundancy.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - **Recursive bundling** → Transactions can be **bundled within bundles**, enabling **theoretical infinite scalability**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: These innovations make Arweave a **robust solution for decentralized, permanent data storage**.

title: Scalability and Technical Innovations
content: - [How Arweave Scales: Storing All the Data on the Web](https://arweave.org/)

title: Introduction to AO
content: title: "Introduction to AO: A Decentralized Compute Platform on Arweave"

title: Introduction to AO
content: description: "Discover AO, a revolutionary decentralized compute platform built on Arweave that leverages hyper-parallel computing for unlimited task execution and efficient decentralized applications."

title: Introduction to AO
content: AO is a **decentralized compute platform** built on Arweave that introduces a **revolutionary way to process and execute computations at scale**.

title: Introduction to AO

content: title: "How is Arweave + AO Different from Other Web3 Ecosystems?"

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: description: "Explore how Arweave and AO differ from Ethereum, Solana, and other Web3 platforms in terms of storage, scalability, compute, and more."

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: ## ⚡ How is Arweave + AO Different from Other Web3 Ecosystems?

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: While Ethereum, Solana, and Polygon have pioneered decentralized applications, **Arweave and AO** introduce a novel paradigm — combining **permanent storage** with **scalable, parallel computation**.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Storage**            | IPFS/Filecoin (temporary, needs pinning) | **Arweave offers permanent, immutable storage** with a one-time payment |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Smart Contracts**    | Solidity/Rust-based contracts with gas fees and compute limits | **AO supports scalable, parallel execution** using Lua |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Execution Model**    | Sequential (prone to congestion, high gas fees) | **Parallel compute** allows faster, scalable processing |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Scalability**        | Needs L2s like Optimism or Arbitrum | **Horizontally scalable by default** via AO Compute Units |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: | **Interoperability**   | EVM-compatible chains only | **AO can interact with many chains** via messaging |

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **📦 Permanent Data**: Arweave ensures your content is never lost — stored forever across a decentralized archive.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **⚙️ Decentralized Compute**: AO runs logic not on a single server or VM, but as autonomous agents spread across the network.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **🧩 Modular Design**: Developers can choose how computation behaves, what languages it runs, and how it’s secured.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **🔗 Cross-Chain Friendly**: AO’s message-based model can interact with other chains, without needing to wrap tokens or use bridges.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **Actor-Oriented Execution**: AO processes (called “agents”) act like bots — they respond to inputs, run logic, and store results.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **No Gas Bottlenecks**: Instead of congested fee markets, AO scales horizontally. More demand? More Compute Units are spun up.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: - **AOS — A Decentralized Operating System**: Developers can launch and interact with AO agents like they're Unix processes — but decentralized and immortal.

title: Comparing Web3 Full Stack Applications
content: Arweave and AO provide a more durable, scalable, and truly decentralized alternative to current Web3 stacks. Build apps that **don’t expire**, **don’t crash**, and **don’t get priced out**.

content: ## 🛠️ How Are Applications Built on Arweave + AO Different?

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Aspect**            | **Web2 Full-Stack Apps**                          | **Web3 Ecosystems (Ethereum, Solana, IPFS, etc.)**               | **Arweave + AO The Computer**                          |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Hosting & Backend** | Uses centralized cloud providers (AWS, Firebase, Vercel) | Some decentralized hosting (IPFS, Filecoin) but limited permanence | Fully decentralized hosting & compute (Arweave + AO) |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Storage**          | Databases like PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Firebase (data can be altered/deleted) | Uses IPFS/Filecoin (but requires pinning to keep data accessible) | **Arweave provides permanent, immutable storage** |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Compute Execution** | Runs on centralized servers (Node.js, Python, Go, etc.) | Smart contracts execute on-chain (Ethereum/Solana) but limited in scope | **AO enables scalable, parallel, decentralized execution** |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Smart Contracts**  | Uses Node.js, Python, Express for API logic | Solidity (Ethereum), Rust (Solana) | **AO uses Lua for execution and for contract logic** |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Databases**        | SQL (PostgreSQL, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Firebase) | Indexed event logs, IPFS/Filecoin for partial data storage | **Databases can be written inside AO (currently SQLite3)** |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: | **Frontend & Routing** | Uses Next.js, Vite, traditional SSR/CSR models | Same frameworks, but relies on blockchain nodes for querying | **Same frontend stack (Next.js, Vite, React)**, routing works differently (Arweave gateways instead of servers) |

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Frontend development stays the same** → You still use Next.js, Vite, TailwindCSS, etc.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Routing system differs** → Since Arweave stores content permanently, it uses gateways instead of standard API-based routing.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **No backend servers needed** → Instead of Express.js, FastAPI, or Node-based backends, AO acts as the backend & middleware.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **AO uses Lua** for execution → If you need complex logic, AO replaces the backend with **Lua-based compute**.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Databases inside AO** → Instead of Firebase/PostgreSQL, you can write **SQLite3 databases inside AO**.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: AO (Actor-Oriented) is a decentralized computing system built on Arweave, designed to support massively parallel computations. Its architecture is modular, comprising several key components:

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: 1. **Processes**: Independent units of computation that can run concurrently. Each process is akin to a smart contract and can be customized with specific computing requirements.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: 2. **Messages**: The primary means of communication between processes. Messages are stored on Arweave, ensuring transparency and verifiability.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: 3. **Scheduler Units (SUs)**: Responsible for ordering messages and ensuring they are processed in the correct sequence.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: 4. **Compute Units (CUs)**: Execute the computational tasks defined by processes. CUs operate in a decentralized marketplace, competing to provide computation services.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: 5. **Messenger Units (MUs)**: Facilitate communication between processes, ensuring messages are delivered reliably.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: This architecture allows AO to achieve high scalability and flexibility, enabling developers to build complex, decentralized applications that can handle large-scale computations efficiently.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Permanent Data Storage**: Arweave ensures that all data is stored permanently and immutably, eliminating concerns about data loss or tampering.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Scalable Compute**: AO's architecture allows for horizontal scaling, meaning that as more compute resources are added, the system's capacity increases proportionally.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Modular Design**: Developers can choose their preferred virtual machines, security models, and payment mechanisms, tailoring the environment to their specific needs.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Trustless Execution**: By leveraging Arweave's immutable storage and AO's decentralized compute, applications can operate without relying on centralized authorities.

title: How Applications Built on Arweave + AO differ
content: - **Support for Autonomous Agents**: AO enables the creation of autonomous agents and scheduled tasks (cron jobs), facilitating the development of self-operating applications.

content: description: "Explore the AR token's function in Arweave's permanent storage network, including its supply, distribution, and economic sustainability."

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: The **AR token** fuels Arweave’s **permanent storage network**, providing **long-term economic sustainability**.

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: - **Data Upload Fees** → Users pay AR for **one-time, permanent storage**.

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: - **Miner Rewards** → Miners earn AR for verifying stored data.

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: title: "Understanding the AR Token and Its Role in Arweave's Economy"

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: description: "Explore the significance of the AR token in Arweave's permanent storage network, including its utility, supply, and economic sustainability."

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: The **AR token** is central to Arweave’s **permanent storage economy**, ensuring network sustainability.

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: - **Data Upload Fees** → One-time payment for permanent storage.

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: - **Miner Incentives** → Miners earn AR for securing and verifying network data.

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: - **95% of fees** go to a **long-term storage endowment**.

title: Arweave Tokenomics
content: - Ensures data storage is funded **for centuries**.
